00029 /***************************************************************************//**
00030  * Where to add support for new ATmega devices.
00031  *
00032  * This header makes it easy to add support for programming new ATmega devices.
00033  * To add a new device a new row should be added to @c atmega_infoTable and
00034  * @c atmega_strings. When the project is recompiled, the new device will be
00035  * recognised.
00036  *
00037  * References:
00038  *  - Atmel, ATmega128 Datasheet.
00039  *  - Atmel, ATmega1281 Datasheet.
00040  *  - Atmel, ATmega325P Datasheet.
00041  *  - Atmel, ATmega2561 Datasheet.
00042  *
00043  * @file atmegaDevices.h
00044  * @date 24-Jan-2010
00045  * @author Se√°n Harte
00046  ******************************************************************************/
00047 
00048 
00049 #ifndef ATMEGADEVICES_H
00050 #define ATMEGADEVICES_H
00051 
00052 
00053 #define ATMEGA_ATMEGA128_SIG    0x1E9702
00054 #define ATMEGA_ATMEGA1281_SIG   0x1E9704
00055 #define ATMEGA_ATMEGA2561_SIG   0x1E9802
00056 #define ATMEGA_ATMEGA325P_SIG   0x1E950D
00057 
00058 
00059 /**
00060  * A number of different ATmega microcontrollers can be supported, as long as
00061  * they support SPI memory programming. For example ATmega128, ATmega325, or
00062  * ATmega2561. Note that this program uses page programming for Flash and slower
00063  * byte programming for EEPROM as this is supported by most Atmegas. The ATmega
00064  * is identified by it's signature bytes. The values in the table below show the
00065  * details about memory sizes for each signature ID.
00066  * @verbatim
00067            Signature      | Flash |   Flash   | EEPROM |  EEPROM
00068              Bytes        | Size  | Page Size |  Size  | Page Size
00069    @endverbatim
00070  **/
00071 uint32_t atmega_infoTable[][5] = {
00072     { ATMEGA_ATMEGA128_SIG, 131072,        256,    4096,          8},
00073     {ATMEGA_ATMEGA1281_SIG, 131072,        256,    4096,          8},
00074     {ATMEGA_ATMEGA2561_SIG, 262144,        256,    4096,          8},
00075     {ATMEGA_ATMEGA325P_SIG,  32768,        128,    1024,          4}
00076 };
00077 
00078 
00079 /**
00080  * Strings printed to the screen to identify the chip, MUST be in the same order
00081  * as the table above.
00082  **/
00083 const char* atmega_strings[] = {
00084     "ATmega128",
00085     "Atmega1281",
00086     "ATmega2561",
00087     "Atmega325P"
00088 };
00089 
00090 #endif
